content.detailedDescription:
I was playing out the back yard of my home with my wife and son when we saw what looked to be a large star-like object (>venus at sundown) at about 45 degrees to the horizon hovering motionless. at fist i thought it was a balloon before realizing that it is way too high, and therefore would be too large. it was also holding position against a fairly consistent 20 km/h ne wind at sea-level... ergo, could not have been a balloon. after a time of hovering it meandered against the prevailing winds towards the eastern horizon for some minutes before disappearing behind a mare's tail cloud. it was rose colored and appeared to have a white luminescence at its center. i took some photos which i would have to pixel down before uploading.

some 10 or so minutes after that i saw yet another object (or the same one?) just 'appear' straight over head but at roughly the same altitude. it seemed larger giving me the impression that it was closer to us being directly over us. it too was a rose color, again defying the prevailing winds if it were to have been a balloon. also i noticed through the view finder of my camera that it was quite iridescent and had a distinct glowing yellow light near to its center. after hovering for several minutes in a now clear blue sky overhead it merely disappeared from view as i reviewed the photos that i had taken of it before looking back up (this took only a moment to look up again after reviewing the photos). in the photos the rose and yellow color are quite distinct; query whether they were not in fact some lighting separate to a 3pm glow reflected from the sun. no other objects were seen. my family also witnessed it.

the photos will need to be reduced tin file size to upload properly; something i will endeavor to do soon.
content.summary: 2 objects of different colors hovering before slow easterly path

content.detailedDescription: While in the car driving south at 9:55 pm in north phoenix, az, i witnessed a very bright light race across the sky from south to southwest at a rapid speed.  it was approximately a mile away and it was approximately 60 degrees above the horizon.  it was light in the area due to the neighborhood and city lights.  therefore, i feel the light had to be unusually bright.  not a star but something much brighter.  i was shocked and wondered wat it could be.  i have lived in az all my life and neverhave seen anything like this.
content.summary: Saw a very bright light fly across the sky very fast. it was too bright and large to be a star.

content.detailedDescription: at approximately 21:30 on friday, 21 september 2013 my wife and i witnessed 2 pairs of red orbs in the northern sky slowly traveling east & then northeast. each set of orbs, one pair slightly following another, moved silently, and maintained a precise formation insomuch as keeping the distance between each individual orb and its respective partner. the second pair was in a formation that had one orb slightly southwest in relation to the other, while the first pair was oriented in an east to west fashion. i have video of this event.
content.summary: 2 pairs of orbs slowly floated along a path from nw to ne

content.detailedDescription:
Every single night at 10:30pm there is a tiny orange light in the sky above austintown, oh. sometimes it sits still in the sky and sometimes it will move as if it is flying. the light does not blink at all but it will fade in and out randomly as if it is moving closer and farther away. it usually only last a few minutes. it usually appears in eastern part of the sky. on july 4, 2013 we saw the orange light as we usually do while setting off fireworks, however that night it was different than usual because we also saw another orange light and a red light in the opposite side of the sky and they were obviously not fireworks. after we saw the usual light, a helicopter appeared in the opposite side of the sky oddly close, we assumed it was a state highway patrol helicopter as we were in close proximity to the highway. while we were looking at the chopper, a new orange light and a red light appeared in the same side of the sky. they both looked and acted just like the orange light we see every night in the eastern side of the sky. they sat still sometimes, flew around sometimes, and faded in and out of view randomly. these 3 lights appeared and disappeared over and over for about 35 mins that night which was definitely unusual.
1. in austintown, oh near rt 11. we were setting off fireworks and listening to the radio which was unaffected by the lights.
2. we were already watching the sky because we were lighting fireworks.
3. we immediately were convinced they were ufos because we see one every night at 10:30pm.
4. one orange light on one side of the sky (the usual light), one orange and one red (separate) light in the opposite side of the sky. they sat still for a minute then moved left or right randomly as if they were flying around. they would fade out completely and grow brighter randomly. they didnt leave trails when they moved. no noise. didnt have any affect on the fm radio that was playing or any affect on cell phones that we noticed. i dont remember the dogs acting weird either.
5. we all felt amazed and extremely intrigued, but normal. we all just stared until we didnt see them anymore and checked the radio stations to see if they were talking about it at all. my small children were scared and paranoid.
6. eventually all 3 lights faded out of view at different times.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Saw 3 seperate lights in sky

content.detailedDescription: Was looking for the dog opened the door to see if she was outside saw this bright glowing orb as soon as i stepped out.  it was moving side to side slightly like it may have wobbled.  i called my wife to see it.  the got in the car and drove to the barn to get a closer look. while i was on the way to the barn trees and a building blocked my view.  when i got to the barn the object had moved about a half mile west.  i returned to the house and it was back in the place it began.  i then told my wife to watch it while i went back to the barn by then it had moved back to the west about a half mile then it vanished.  when i got back i ask her how it moved she said it looked like it had just got lower.  i tried to take a picture but the camera wouldn't focus on it. i think it was to bright.
content.summary: Bright orange orb

content.detailedDescription: family members and i were coming home from a trip to the red river gorge in two separate vehicles, traveling north on us highway 27 in northern ky. passing out of falmouth ky around 9pm, we saw a bright yellowish-orange light ascending out of the tree line to the north east.  as we watched, trying to understand what we were seeing, more lights followed the first, forming a delta triangular formation. this formation ascended until it was overhead traveling in an ascending southeast direction.  at this point, we all felt this was an unusual event, and possible extraterrestrial in nature. the driver of the vehicle that i was in, pulled over to the side of the road, so that we could get a better view and take pictures/video.  (we had cameras handy because of our daytrip to natural bridge ky, and the kids taking pictures of things along the road trip home.)  the car following us pulled over behind us, and we all got out to view the event.  as we watched, more lights trailed the first group, following a roughly straight-line path to the southeast.  during this first event, we saw a series of approximately 13 lights in all.  the lights were a steady bright yellow-orange, moved steadily but slowly across the sky, almost hovering at times, and followed a clear arc across the sky passing directly overhead, and then moving past us until they began to disappear fading out in the far southeastern sky.  there were 6 adults, 3 teens and two kids with us, and we all had varying reactions to the events.  i was excited and exhilarated.  some of us were scared and disturbed.  others were dumbstruck and confused, trying to come up with a rational explanation for the strange series of lights. i felt consistently that we were viewing ufo's and possibly extraterrestrial spacecraft. other explanations which were thrown out were: chinese lanterns/flares/missiles/and unknown military aircraft.  the lights moved too controlled and deliberately across the sky, rising steadily and moving at a relatively constant pace to be anything random or unmanned/controlled.  as we watched, the first lights began to break formation and one light sped up and jumped ahead until fading out of sight.  all the lights moved to the same area of the sky before likewise fading out.  having watched the lights for roughly 12 minutes, we began to become concerned, and even scared.  if this was not a series of extraterrestrial spacecraft, then we might be watching missile launchings and could be about to experience a nuclear war and worse.  we wanted to get home and see if there was any related news reports or other possible explanations.  as we left the area, the lights continued to rise and fill the sky.  on the way home, other lights came up in a more horizontal string and then the sightings stopped.  overall, we figure there had been anywhere between 18 and 24 lights all following the same basic slow steady path across the sky. there were no news reports and no other related information corroborated our experience. during the event there was no accompanying sounds, the lights traveling through the sky in absolute silence. it was hard to determine any size or distance, as the objects may have been external lights attached to a larger object that we couldn't actually see, or the lights were themselves the objects and much higher in the sky.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Series of lights rising out of treeline in various formations, ascending past observer over highway than disappearing in sequence.

content.detailedDescription:
10:15 pm -12.02am

lake saint clair

at a location approximately 2 miles due east of selfridge air national guard base out over the middle of anchor bay on lake st. clair. i had just let the dog out in back yard on anchor bay when i noticed white lights in rotating patterns. there were two sets of approximately four lights each that were rotating as if chasing each other. the motion of the lights was in a counter clockwise pattern and generally the objects circled continuously some times moving faster or slower. they mostly maintained an equal distance between each other but occasionally seemed to clump up a little closer together. there were a total of 8 round lights with four lights each in two rotating paths adjacent to each other. 

the lights appeared to vary some what in brightness but this may simply be due to the variation in the thickness of the cloud cover over head. the lights appeared to be slightly above the cloud ceiling which is reported to be at 5,500 to 5,900 ft according to the weather channel.

currently it is approximately 56 degrees f with winds nw 10 but gusting much higher. humidity 65% visibility 10 miles. pressure 29.85 in

i have lived on the lake since 1973 and spent a lot of time boating on the lake at night. until tonight, i have never seen anything like this before. what ever this is--it is a very unusual phenomena. while the lights were sighted near a military base; i did not observed any fixed wing or rotor aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.

12:02am

the lights were still moving in circle patterns but i am tired and going to bed.
content.summary: Two rotating sets of white orb like lights. four orbs in each set.

content.detailedDescription: Driving home with 2 car loads of people. looked up and seen a triangle of lights. started hitting my husband and pointing to the sky. my husband then seen it and the rest of the people in my car. so we pulled over on the side of the road and got out of the car. my sister and brother pulled over behind us they all seen the same thing. my husband and daughter started taking pictures i then took the camera and recorded video. we then decided to get to the house and try to watch the news, but we were to excited and just kept talking bout it.
content.summary: Driving north on us27 looked up and there was 3 lights flying over in the shape of triangle then 2 then 2 more then about 11 more one after another.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking my wife and dog and off to my right i spotted an orange orb hovering over the rooftops of houses. i asked my wife "what is that???" i said "it's not of this world." i had watery eyes because i knew what i was seeing was not an every day event. we observed it for about a minute and then it faded out for about 45 seconds to a minute. in the same place, it came right back again. it moved slightly to the left, then slightly to the right. then, it appeared to come forward slightly. that was about another 45 seconds to a minute. then it disappeared for another minute and then it came back again and lit up again. the same thing happened for another minute. then it lit up and never came back. my wife and i went back to our car to get our camera, but it never reappeared. (this took place by concordia lutheran school.)
content.summary: Orange orb hovering over south penticton over skaha lake, penticton

content.detailedDescription: I was outside working on my car then went for a short test drive down my court. upon turning around and facing north i saw 15 glowing red orange orbs in the clear night sky. all of the orbs were spinning in spherical orbits independently of one another. the entire formation was moving n to ne with all orbs changing position within the cloud in no observed pattern. after a period of 5 min est., slowly the lights vanished in a blink or accelerated away and vanished like shutting off a light switch. i thought it could be bags with candles for lifts or ballons but the objects spun in spherical orbits at constant speed with many altitude changes up and down. from my perspective the altitude changes were 100's of feet in the sky. also the objects were seen flying double the height of aircraft  nearby in the same line of sight. the lights also disappeared individually at different times at different heights meaning that if it was a flame the lack of o2 at height would burn out the highest theoretical ballons or candles. however there was o pattern to the light going out and several made accelerated course corrections before going out.
content.summary: 15 orange orbs spinning in circles in cloud formation with extreme altitude changes up and down.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside by the campfire checking my phone. i felt like looking at the stars. i noticed a pair of lights flying in the same direction. they where spaced with a great deal of distance between them. they changed elevation and flew up near where the clouds would start. they then changed direction just before going out of my line of sight. i know what a airplane looks like at night and other military aircraft to. this what not any of these. i felt weird and wanted to keep looking at it. it was really neat, i didn't feel scared at all.
content.summary: There were two lights flying in a like banking  pattern and continued on.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from my dads house around nine pm. my girlfriend and i saw them in the distance and as we got closer we ended up directly underneath them. they hovered above our head for about two minutes. the orange orb on the left disappeared and one on the right cover approximately ten mile in about two seconds. we first noticed the objects because of the orange glow. at first glance we thought they were helicopters until we got underneath them and they were not moving but just floating. i was shocked and intrigued at the same time. i lost sight of the object after it moved too far off in the distance.
content.summary: Two orange orbs hovering then covered an estimated distance of 10 mile within seconds

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving south from teulon,mb to winnipeg, mb on highway 7. i glanced up in the sky and had seen a triangle shape of 3 un connected lights flying west. it was sunny and clear conditions. the airport is close to there and south from where i was driving. normally lots of air traffic in that area. considering the conditions i would of been able to see something connecting the lights if it was an airplane or something else. it was 3 separate objects and an airplane was in view heading to the southern direction. the objects were much higher than the airplane. the objects then turned to the south aswell  and appeared to be in a perfectly straight line. i could see the lights go further away and all of a sudden they just vanished. the airplane that was flying south towards the airport i could still see plainly. 

when i first saw the object i figured it was an airplane going to the airport but i quickly noticed nothing was connecting the lights. i felt very intrigued to find out more so i kept my eyes on the object. i lost sight of the object because it went out of sight. it just vanished as if it went into a cloud slowly. however there was no clouds. it kept getting fainter and fainter very quickly until it was gone.
content.summary: 3 lights in triangle formation, change direction and appear in straight line, disappear after.

content.detailedDescription: I was just done delivering and i lean forward to change sirius radio station and i see a black triangle with three dull whitelights hovering above the hood of the vehicle while i was driving and it went straight up at my cruising speed and it was about 50 feet long on 3 sides. i never lost satellite radio reception and the antenna was on my dash. i should've lost radio reception seconds after it appeared. the fact i still had reception may be a clue to more about it.
content.summary: Triangle hovered over my truck as i drove

content.detailedDescription: I was just done delivering and i lean forward to change sirius radio station and i see a black triangle with three dull whitelights hovering above the hood of the vehicle while i was driving and it went straight up at my cruising speed and it was about 50 feet long on 3 sides. i never lost satellite radio reception and the antenna was on my dash. i should've lost radio reception seconds after it appeared. the fact i still had reception may be a clue to more about it.
content.summary: Triangle hovered over my truck as i drove

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving at the time when i noticed what looked like a 2 dimensional oval very large. i could tell that this object was very large, because it was above the clouds (cloudy windy day). very reflective and bright right above the tree line the reflection of the object showed through the gray cloudy sky. at first i thought it may have been a blimp or something of that nature. it was moving at a constant speed at first, then took off at speeds that i have never seen before in the sky. i chased it with my car as the i lost sight of it behind the tree line. i spent 30 minutes looking for the object in the sky around the area but no luck. the vast size and speed of this ufo is what truly astonished me. i can understand now how people could miss such a vast ufo, it came in and out of my sight within 30-50 seconds, too short for me to even capture a picture of it from my phone. one of the most unexplained things i have never seen in my life. no trail, no sounds, moving at speeds that i have never witnessed.

me: college graduate
    23 years old
    not under any influence
content.summary: Saw a very large reflective disk above the clouds hovering then took off at a speed i have never seen in the sky before.

content.detailedDescription:
I was flying west on an airbus 320, probably over new mexico. we were probably at least 25,000 feet up. i had a window seat on the starboard side and was enjoying watching electrical storms dance across the northern sky. the big dipper was hanging low in the northern sky and was visible most of the time with the lightning activity below. intermittent patches of clouds sometimes obscured my view of the stars, but most of the time i had a spectacular view of the sky above a long line of storms to the north which stretched approximately from the mid-western states to western new mexico. 

it was after a short period of cloud obstruction when the strange lights appeared. 

if you were to mark a spot midway between a line joining the two stars at the end of the handle of the big dipper and draw a line perpendicular to and up from that line, the lights appeared on that line at a point about a third longer than the line joining the two stars. they were slightly brighter than those two stars and appeared white. at arm's length they were about a pinky finger's width apart. 

i'm familiar with that area of the sky and knew immediately that they couldn't have been stars, planets, or any other celestial body. my first thought was that they were satellites, so i watched them for any movement. they remained perfectly motionless like stars for about a full minute. then briefly for several seconds, my eyes were drawn to a few flashes of lighting below. then when i looked back up, the two lights had disappeared. i continued watching that area of the sky for at least 15 minutes afterwards but they never reappeared.
content.summary: Two motionless star-like objects appear for at least a minute then disappear

content.detailedDescription: I was riding east on motorcycle and i love sunrises i take a lot of them . this ones different because what i saw after i look at it there it was !
content.summary: I didn't see until i looked at picture . i was on motorcycle and took sunrise pic and weird clouds

content.detailedDescription:
It started in may 2013 i was looking at orion when what appeared to be a star flew a straight path or my home. i was in the back and ran threw the house to follow it, but when i got to the front it was gone. a few days later why i was watching the star same event occur. i repeated the same events as above with the same results. so i started to actively looking for these lights. i seen so many that i lost count. 
i thought that maybe they were man made like iss. i found out that yu can only view things like the iss up to 45 minutes after sunset. so see them so close to 10 pm ruled them out. they were flying straight and mostly from the south to north. then in early august one was like watching a drunk driver weaving back and forth. i was at a lost to explain that. then a few minutes later two were flying right at each other one from the north and the other from the south. the look like they were going to hit. then the one from the north stopped and the one from the south did a 90 degree turn to the east then another 90 to put it heading back north. if its a clear night you can see happening. i willing to show anyone who like to come out and see between 8:40 to 10:00 pm. i tried filming then put my video cam has only pick it up once and it like a second. if you have a stronger cam then please come film.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: When ever its clear multi light looking like stars fly over my home nightly.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside during both events smoking a cigarette. the first event was about 1 a.M. sept. 20 and the second event was about 1:45 a.M. sept. 21, 2013 the first time i noticed a star-like object coming from the north. it was bright and had many flashing lights. it passed overhead and the "split" into two bright lights. they blinked back and forth several times then stopped and hovered for about 5 minutes. then slowly changed direction and went towards the east. the same exact thing happened last night except this time it was coming from the west and "split up" the objects blinked on and off and then took off toward the north.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 2 separate events but i believe the same crafts were involved

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were camping out last night in a clearing at the top of the mountain on our property. clear skies. bright moon. many planes in usual flight paths. suddenly, looking n we both noticed a brightly lit white object that just floated across the sky over us. lower than planes. as we're watching it, all of the sudden the light went out. not five minutes later the same scene repeated itself. exactly. definitely too low to be satellites. no blinking lights, no sound, no emmisions. did notice that it got windy then, when it had been very still. maybe 15 minutes later we were looking toward the se and saw a new one moving e to w. same as the other two, although this one was amber in color. this one stayed lit and disappeared behind the tree line. after it left i turned my attention back to the n and just like that a shooting star flew overhead! this all took place with about 20 minutes. we were not surprised as we have seen these for about the last 3 years on this mountain. not afraid either. we went to sleep in the tent about an hour later. nothing out of the ordinary occurred while we were asleep. oh, and the first 2 orbs were traveling s to n.
content.summary: Three glowing orbs witnessed while camping on top of mountain near poconos.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were camping out last night in a clearing at the top of the mountain on our property. clear skies. bright moon. many planes in usual flight paths. suddenly, looking n we both noticed a brightly lit white object that just floated across the sky over us. lower than planes. as we're watching it, all of the sudden the light went out. not five minutes later the same scene repeated itself. exactly. definitely too low to be satellites. no blinking lights, no sound, no emmisions. did notice that it got windy then, when it had been very still. maybe 15 minutes later we were looking toward the se and saw a new one moving e to w. same as the other two, although this one was amber in color. this one stayed lit and disappeared behind the tree line. after it left i turned my attention back to the n and just like that a shooting star flew overhead! this all took place with about 20 minutes. we were not surprised as we have seen these for about the last 3 years on this mountain. not afraid either. we went to sleep in the tent about an hour later. nothing out of the ordinary occurred while we were asleep. oh, and the first 2 orbs were traveling s to n.
content.summary: Three glowing orbs witnessed while camping on top of mountain near poconos.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i had returned home from dinner out, when we were ready to close the garage door and lock up the house.  she noticed two lights in the sky and called for me to come and see them.  we observed two 'orb' type lights circling above us, at approximately 2-3000 ft altitude, describing a circular path, estimated to be 500 - 1,000 ft diameter.  the lights were a teal green in color, or a blue - green hue.  the lights themselves were not defined by any shape or hard surface, simply 'lights'. 

the sky was clear, with low hanging cumulus clouds, drifting at around 5 knots from south to north.  the stars were visible, and there was no weather threatening, or nearby storms.  

the circling lights looked like undefined shapes, not delineated.  i first thought they could have been projected, like maybe some kids playing with laser pointers.  after observing these light continuously for over an hour, i became convinced they were not projected.  they were highly visible, and could be seen behind the clouds, between the clouds, and against the clouds. 

the circular flight pattern did not vary, but the two lights would sometimes be very close together, and then separate until they were opposite each other, still moving in a circular pattern. round and round, not varying, just round and round.  it was fascinating to watch, and we both observed the lights for over an hour.  as the clouds moved across the sky, the lights were still there.  as the clouds disapated, the lights were still visible, but not as much as when the clouds were present.  

i know about clouds, winds, elevation and altitude from being a navigator in my early days in the navy.  i was taught to observe weather, etc as part of my duties. 

i am certain there were others who saw these lights, and hope my observation will be confirmed.  i will be glad to discuss this with anyone from mufon, and you are welcome to contact me.  this was an interesting observation, and i will be looking again tonight to see if it is repeated. i have other sightings, including a uso sighting that i have never reported.  i have never seen a similar sight like the circling orbs i report here. 

thanks to mufon for being here, giving me an opportunity to relate this sighting to someone.  

best regards,

steve mason
content.summary: Witnessed two blue green lights circling in sky continuously.  sometimes, the lights would almost join, then spread apart circling in a tight pattern. at times, the lights would be opposite each other in the circular pattern, then they would be closer .

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i had just left her house in her vehicle, and going down a suburban rode i noticed some lights in the sky. at first i wrote them off as jets or something but the number and arrangement of them confused me so i tried to continue observing (as i was driving.) they moved irregularly, unlike any aircraft that i have knowledge of. at first, they were arranged like this -

*

*

 *

              *


*

and they would move some, to the left and/or right a bit (each one moved independently of the others) and would stop and hover before moving any more. i passed some trees and then when i saw them again they were all arranged in a perfectly vertical line, hardly moving at all. they had a dull orange glow (like a jet engine) but the intensity of the light never changed, indicating to me that they were neither moving closer nor further from my location. at this point i stopped the car so that my girlfriend could try and get a picture (i was pretty sure this was something noteworthy at this point) but her iphone could not get any kind of picture (probably due to the street lights and their light pollution.) we continued observing for a minute even though we were running late for a gig we were already supposed to be at, but the lights disappeared, one after the other. they didn't leave in sequential order, either - the highest one, then the third highest one, then the fourth, then the second, then the lowest one. when each departed, it quickly went from completely static to just a faint light, seemingly traveling very quickly from a dead stop.

i have never before seen anything like this, and at first i tried to rationalize it (virginia beach/norfolk area is a military area, so aircraft are a common sight) but it legitimately looked like so many other ufo sighting videos i have seen. the erratic movement, the vertical formation, the ability to stop and go again effortlessly - i'm not saying it was an "alien spacecraft" but it certainly was an unidentified flying object. the biggest emotion i felt after seeing them was regret at my inability to document them visually. i haven't heard of anyone else that witnessed them last night and i have been looking all morning for confirmation. i have also been looking for any knowledge of aircraft that can seemingly stop and start on a dime but i have found nothing.

i'm very interested to find out if anyone saw these as well and if anyone has any insight as to what they were!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Strange lights arranged themselves in a vertical column. abrupt stopping and irregular movement patterns.

content.detailedDescription:
Taking my dogs out before retiring for the night, a bright sparkly multi-
colored lights got my attention, i ran into the house, grabbed my binoculars... i don't see it move, it's stationary, just blinking away red,
blue, green, white, orange lights...I thought it was a plane at first, but it didn't move, other planes seem to fly above and below this object.  i thought it could be a star so i looked at the stars that seemed close to this thing, but the stars were bluish white twinkling, not like this thing
flashing, it felt like, to me, it wanted to be recognized like "hey look at me."  i took my dogs back into the house, sat down to watch tv, but i couldn't get this thing out of my mind. so i went backout, and to my surprise, now two more of the same were in a triangular configuration, miles apart in the ne to e to se sky all blinking away like crazy.  where i live, this is the area where the shuttle launches into space.  wish i a telephoto lens with a camera...This thing(s) don't appear every nite, but i have been noticing them more frequently.
content.summary: Seem to be hoovering over the space center

content.detailedDescription: I was cycling across the burrard street bridge at around 11:10pm on my way home from work on the night of thursday,september 19th. i looked to my right (east, and observed a jet coming in towards the city airport. i then looked ahead towards downtown / yaletown, and saw what appeared to be an orange-red light about 40 degrees elevation to me. i first thought it was a crane light on one of the new sky rises going up in yaletown, but then noticed that it was becoming larger and coming towards me. it passed overhead just to the right of me (the jet spotted earlier was about 3 times as high and passed above and to the right of the object. i thought that it might be a chinese lantern, but it was moving too fast in a sw direction. it was glowing orange red--there didn't seem to be lights separate from the object. it looked angular, but i could not make out a distinct shape. i stopped, got off my bike, and watched the object cross the sky. it made no noise and did not seem to leave any kind of trail. i saw people walking on the other side of the bridge but no one seemed to take notice. there appeared a faint flicker from the front/top of the object as though on fire, but no actual flames were visible. i attempted to photograph it, but i was directly next to a street lamp and that is all i could see on my phone's screen. i called a friend who's apartment patio overlooked the west and asked if he could see it, but he replied that he could not. after about 2 1/2 - 3 minutes, the object had passed over me and disappeared on the sw horizon.
content.summary: Object appeared angular and appeared on fire: flickered orange-red.

content.detailedDescription: I was in side when my sister call me out side to look at them when i seen them i never seen some thing like that before thay went up behind the clouds.
content.summary: September 20, 2013 role of them  from east to west

content.detailedDescription:
1. outside, enjoying a bonfire with four other persons (all seen it)
2. not sure, just happened to notice out the corner of my eye.
3. ufo
4. ufo appeared to be heading west to east, then when spotted by four said individuals it abruptly changed direction to the sw staying just above and behind the tree line (acting as if it was hiding) and disappeared after traveling sw down the road. ufo was traveling too fast to be an airplane and was flying low, made absolutely no noise. 
5. when first sighted, first observer (me) exclaimed "what is that?!" as soon as i said that everyone seen it immediately and could not associate it with any known objects.    
6. yes, after it went sw past the tree line.
content.summary: Orange ball w/ two amber colored exterior lights headed east, then when spotted turned abruptly to se.
